Real Madrid are still fully invested in Van de Beek and want to pay the €55 million asking price.

Tottenham were also said to be interested in the 22-year-old, but in conversations with the club, Van de Beek has indicated that he prefers Real Madrid. [@telegraaf]

For Van de Beek, a multi-year contract is ready in the Spanish capital, and Real are now ready to pay Ajax's asking price. Just a matter of time. [@telegraaf]

BALE ‘NEVER ASKED TO LEAVE’ REAL

Gareth Bale has never asked to leave Real Madrid despite not feeling ‘ecstatic’ about life at the club, according to his agent.

Bale added fuel to those questioning commitment to the 13-time European champions when he celebrated Wales’ qualification for Euro 2020 by holding a flag which read ‘Wales. Golf. Madrid. In that order’.

“He’s not ecstatic,” Bale’s agent Jonathan Barnett told the BBC. “He has got a contract and as long as he is a Real Madrid player, he will play at 100 per cent – and do very well.

“He has never asked to leave. If the right opportunity came along for him and it’s something he wants to do we have to have a chat with the president of Real Madrid and see where we are at.”

Raphaël Varane praises Cristiano Ronaldo: “I don’t have words to describe him.”

Speaking in an interview with Onze Mondial, Real Madrid and French international central defender Raphaël Varane discussed Cristiano Ronaldo.

“Amazing, amazing. As a person! And as a footballer, I don’t have words to describe him. He has achieved something extraordinary: he has normalised extraordinary achievements. And that, to do that… The fact that we expect even more from him, that is… (he cuts himself off). There are no more words to explain just how crazy, how amazing, how extraordinary he is. He taught me a lot and he amazed me a lot. How many times have I said to myself: “Woah, that’s amazing.” (smiles)”
